titlestmt.titleproper: D.C. Public School Survey, Phase II Oral History ProjectOHP017

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-10-12 12:33:58 -0400.

did.unittitle: D.C. Public School Survey, Phase II Oral History Project

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Between 1998 and 1999 the Historical Society of Washington conducted a total of 40 oral history interviews with adults who had attended D.C. public schools. Topics include educational experiences, schools attended, dates of graduation. The project director was Karen Washburn, Oral Historian for the Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Originally known as the Columbia Historical Society, The Historical Society of Washington, D.C. was founded in 1894. The society is an educational foundation and museum dedicated to preserving and displaying the history of Washington, D.C.; providing lectures, exhibits, classes, community events and other educational programs as part of its mission.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Historical Society of Washington, D.C. conducted these interviews between 1998 and 1999. The transcripts of these interviews were transferred to the Library in the early 2000s. There is no deed of gift for this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: After the initial deposit of the transcripts in the Library, the transcript were bound, cataloged and added to Washingtoniana book collection. There are no taped interviews for this collection. In 2014, the tapes and transcripts were digitized and in 2017 the collection was reprocessed. The transcripts were placed into folders and boxed. All administrative documents were placed into the control file.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The D.C. Public Library does not hold copyright. It is the responsibility of the researcher to obtain permission from the Historical Society of Washington, D.C. to publish or exhibit information. Reproduction of oral histories without release is not permitted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series include transcripts for all interviews.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series include master copies of the oral histories on audio cassette. There are no duplicate copies of any audio recordings. There are no tapes for 19-09 and 19-17.
